div.div: EVOLVING STORIES

div.a: Top Reddit Admin Says Gawker Link Ban Was A 'Mistake'

div.div: Erik Martin tells BuzzFeed FWD via email: "The sitewide ban of the recent Adrien Chen article was a mistake on our part and was fixed this morning. Mods are still free to do what they want in their subreddits."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RpilQR&via=Digg&text=Top Reddit Admin Says Gawker Link Ban Was A 'Mistake'

div.div: SINGLE-ISSUE VOTERS

div.a: Who Is Better For Tech Startups?

div.div: Like other issues in this election, the two candidates' perspectives on how to help tech start-ups seem to boil down to how they view government.
THE NEW BATH SALTS

div.a: Is 'Annihilation' Upon Us? New 'Legal' Drug Lands Nine In Hospital

div.div: This "particularly potent" new synthetic drug imitates the effects of marijuana, and can induce paranoia, aggression, increased heart rate, unconsciousness, and self-harming.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RkAJxx&via=Digg&text=Is 'Annihilation' Upon Us? New 'Legal' Drug Lands Nine In Hospital

div.div: NOT-SO-DUMB QUESTIONS

div.a: Why Is The Sky Dark At Night?

div.div: Here's a question you probably didn't know was a question: Why is the sky dark at night?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QVWSl6&via=Digg&text=Why Is The Sky Dark At Night?

div.div: TOMTOM, STOP MAKING US DUMBER
With new GPS technology, it is almost impossible to get lost nowadays. So how will the death of paper maps change the way we live?
'IN A PERMANENT SAVE STATE'

div.a: Apple Removes iPhone Game Based On Foxconn Suicides From App Store

div.div: Another app runs afoul of the company's "objectionable content" guidelines.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tn2HF0&via=Digg&text=Apple Removes iPhone Game Based On Foxconn Suicides From App Store

div.div: THE MOB COULD HAVE KILLED CASTRO

div.a: Newly Public RFK Documents Shed Light On Cold War

div.div: The National Archives revealed a CIA document outlining a Mafia-connected plan to assassinate Fidel Castro for $150,000.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RU93yA&via=Digg&text=Newly Public RFK Documents Shed Light On Cold War

div.div: PUPPET PROTESTS
Supporters of public television’s “Sesame Street” plan to protest Mitt Romney’s commitment to defund PBS with a “Million Muppet March” at the National Mall on November 3.
INFOGRAPHIC

div.a: What Colors Mean In Different Cultures

div.div: Every culture associates colors with different ideas and emotions. In the U.S., we assign red to hate or anger, blue to sadness, and green to ecology. Do you know how other countries interpret color? The differences may be very surprising.
GEOGLYPHS

div.a: Mysterious Elk-Shaped Structure Discovered In Russia

div.div: A huge geoglyph in the shape of an elk or deer discovered in Russia may predate Peru's famous Nazca Lines by thousands of years.
A DIARY WITH A MIND OF ITS OWN

div.a: When Facebook Outs Your Most Personal Secrets

div.div: "I remember I was miserable and said, Facebook decided to tell my dad that I was gay."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QjSQ4s&via=Digg&text=When Facebook Outs Your Most Personal Secrets

div.div: THE PRIVACY DIVIDE

div.a: Prepare To Pay For Your Privacy

div.div: As surveillance technology gets cheaper much faster than the world’s poorest get wealthier, it may not be long before privacy — any privacy — will begin to feel, seem, and even cost like a luxury.
FREE TRIPS

div.a: The Perks Of Having A Large Instagram Following

div.div: A photographer shares some of the amazing perks that elite Instagram users are enjoying these days.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ounmds&via=Digg&text=The Perks Of Having A Large Instagram Following

div.div: INTERESTING, BUT UNSCIENTIFIC POLLS

div.a: Who Would The World Vote For: Obama Or Romney?

div.div: One candidate is the landslide favorite.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UUAexm&via=Digg&text=Who Would The World Vote For: Obama Or Romney?

div.div: POCKET LIKE IT'S HOT

div.a: Watch Snoop Dogg's Hot Pocket Commercial

div.div: Snoop is no stranger to shilling a song or his likeness for a buck. Now he's shilling hot pockets.
FOOD

div.a: The Best And Worst Dining Experiences According To Former New York Times Restaurant Critics

div.div: New York Times restaurant critics detail a few of their best and worst experiences.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tf1xv8&via=Digg&text=The Best And Worst Dining Experiences According To Former New York Times Restaurant Critics

div.div: EXTRATERRESTRIAL WAR GAMES

div.a: Britain Has Weapons To Fight A War With Aliens, Says Former Government Adviser

div.div: Nick Pope, who worked for the Ministry of Defence for 21 years, said that while Britain doesn't have a war plan, it certainly had sophisticated enough weaponry to defend itself.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TeXsYg&via=Digg&text=Britain Has Weapons To Fight A War With Aliens, Says Former Government Adviser

div.div: FIRST SWISS CLOCKS NOW SWISS PHOTOS?

div.a: Woman Sues Apple Over Use Of Her Eye Photo

div.div: A Swiss photographer is alleging Apple never properly licensed a photo used in ads for the Retina-display Macbook Pros.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RlW2LN&via=Digg&text=Woman Sues Apple Over Use Of Her Eye Photo
